comment._content: The original construction was begun in 1859, by the Attorney-General of Vancouver Island and British Columbia, George H. Cary. After his bankruptcy, the uncompleted buildings were purchased by Governor Arthur Kennedy in 1865; when British Columbia entered Confederation in 1871, 'Cary Castle' became Govenment House. Destroyed by fire, May, 1899, it's replacement would also be destroyed by fire on April 15, 1957. www.ltgov.bc.ca/govhouse/history.htm
